It is characterized by its finely divided, almost translucent leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. This plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures are located on the underside of its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
